Total size : 815 + 514 + 45 + 1678 ≈ 3052 episodes

checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes:
To used in reinforcement learning part of the RL model (O4). Aligns with Datascience and Engineering. 
69 datasets in total. Applicant did not identify which ones they required for their research.
67 out of 69 datasets contain real RGB image observations.

checks.name: Prohibited Use Screening (LC 2.7)
checks.notes:
According to the paper describing the dataset, it contains a range of household objects, from appliances to food items and utensils. https://arxiv.org/html/2310.08864v4 
The dataset contains over 1 million real robot trajectories from 22+ robot embodiments, spanning manipulation tasks like pick-and-place, drawer opening, object rearrangement, and more. The data comes from different labs worldwide, each with their own robot setups.

checks.name: Restricted Entities Screening (LC 2.5)
checks.notes:
All authors of the paper had affiliations in 2023 with organizations from non-D5 countries. 
https://arxiv.org/html/2310.08864v4

checks.name: Provenance
checks.notes:
https://huggingface.co/datasets/Vision-CAIR/InfiniBench
Owned by Vision-CAIR — the same KAUST research group led by Mohamed Elhoseiny (the PI of this proposal). This is an internally developed dataset from the proposing team.

checks.name: License / Permissions
checks.notes:
License: BSD 3-Clause
Permissions :
- Commercial use — May be used for commercial purposes
- Modification — May be modified
- Distribution — May be distributed
- Private use — May be used privately
Conditions :
License and copyright notice — A copy of the license and copyright notice must be included with the software
No trademark use — The license does not grant trademark rights
Restrictions:
- No liability 
- No warranty
Important Note on Underlying Content:
While the InfiniBench annotations and code are BSD 3-Clause licensed, the underlying video content (TV shows like Castle, Friends, House, Big Bang Theory, and movies) remains copyrighted by their respective studios. The dataset provides:
- Question-answer annotations
- Paths/references to video files
- Temporal grounding information
Users must obtain the original video content separately through legitimate means (e.g., TVQA dataset, MovieNet dataset), as the copyright for TV shows and movies belongs to the original content owners.

observations:
No clear request of which models are required for different objectives. Need to consult with the applicant and assess based on the inputs.
Both ROLL and RLinf have maintainers from D5 countries. 
RoboMIND is also a D5 country's opensource contribution.
recommendation: Recommended for grand challenge conditional to acceptable risk with models.
